imagingbook.lib.math

Class Eigensolver2x2

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.math.Eigensolver2x2

  • public class Eigensolver2x2
extends Object
    Implements an efficient, closed form algorithm for calculating the real eigenvalues (λ) and eigenvectors (x) of a 2x2 matrix M of the form 
       | A B |
   | C D |
    There are typically (but not in general) two pairs of real-valued solutions ⟨λ1, x1⟩, ⟨λ2, x2⟩ such that M·xk = λk·xk.

    This implementation is inspired by Blinn, Jim: "Jim Blinn's Corner: Notation, Notation, Notation", Morgan Kaufmann (2002) - Ch. 5 ("Consider the Lowly 2x2 Matrix"). Note that Blinn uses the (common computer graphics) notation x·M = λ·x, while this implementation adopts the notation M·x = λ·x, i.e., the matrix M is transposed (elements B/C are exchanged).

    Version:
    2020-02-09

    • Method Detail

      • isReal

        public boolean isReal()
        Returns true iff the associated matrix has real eigenvalues.
        Returns:
        as described

      • getEigenvalues

        public double[] getEigenvalues()
        Returns a vector holding the two real eigenvalues. Both are NaN if the associated matrix has no real eigenvalues. The first eigenvalue is the greater of the two. Note that the method returns a reference to an internal array and should thus be used read-only!
        Returns:
        a 2-element array of eigenvalues

      • getEigenvectors

        public double[][] getEigenvectors()
        Returns a 2x2 array holding the two real eigenvectors. When used in the form 
        double[][] X = getEigenvalues();
        then X[0] and X[1] contain the 1st and 2nd eigenvector, respectively. If the associated matrix has no real eigenvalues, then X[0] and X[1] are both null. Otherwise X[k][0] and X[k][1] are the x/y components of the k-th eigenvector. The ordering of the returned eigenvectors is the same as for the eigenvalues returned by getEigenvalues(). Note that the method returns a reference to an internal array and should thus be used read-only!
        Returns:
        a 2-element array of 2D eigenvectors
